title: Materials Engineer - Adhesives
role_description:
We are looking for an experienced adhesives engineer/scientist.  

Responsibilities and activities for this position include the following:

•Serve as Apple’s internal adhesive bonding expert by leveraging a thorough understanding of the chemistry and properties of adhesive materials, bonding processes and performance criteria for bonded substrates.

•Lead the development of new adhesive materials and processes to meet the structural and performance requirements of a wide range of product designs.

•Develop collaborative relationships with Apple suppliers in order to influence their multigenerational product development plans to meet material needs anticipated in future Apple product designs.

•Leverage your technical contacts and network with industry experts to discover new technologies, which could be applied to Apple designs for improved performance and differentiation.

•Collaborate with product design and manufacturing design groups on material selection, design feasibility and assembly techniques of new product designs. Create data-rich material matrices to summarize advantages & disadvantages of candidate materials.

•Work with suppliers and internal/external laboratories in order to create material characterization data to support FEA simulation and build engineering confidence in the performance of a material for a given part design.

•Proficient with the use of Design For Manufacturing, SPC and Six Sigma techniques and visit factories to fully understand their capabilities, quality requirements and resolve difficult material-related issues.

title: Product Design Engineer - Computer Vision Scientist
role_description:
The Data Visualization team in Mac Product Design enables data-driven decision making by developing and performing in-depth analysis, modeling, and visualization of unstructured data for engineering and research design teams. Our unique position within the organization allows us to work on a wide range of the products designed at Apple. Each new product pushes the boundaries of design, necessitating innovations in engineering, materials, and manufacturing technologies. Large amounts of unstructured data are collected from many different sources during the research, design, engineering, and production processes and a major challenge is to transform this data into actionable insights to drive decision making for client services, operations, design, and product enhancement. The DataViz team works closely with many cross-functional teams to address this challenge on the latest products. The work we do ultimately impacts products used by millions of people worldwide.

We are seeking an extraordinary individual to join our small, dynamic team as a Computer Vision Scientist. The Mac PD DataViz team works on challenging problems that arise during all stages of product design at Apple. The job requires deep knowledge of processing, modeling, and analyzing 3D images, experience with robotics, object detection/tracking, object recognition, and strong programming skills. The Computer Vision Scientist must be innovative and flexible and be able to use existing skills in new ways to solve problems as they arise with the ability to learn new skills independently when needed. This position also requires a passion for effectively and creatively communicating their results to decision makers at all levels of the company through striking visualizations, informative reports, and presentations.
